item.title: Partial Order
item.description: :ID: a7be7168-8d15-4fe0-a82c-9fd9348b3b93 A Relation \(R\) is said to be a reflexive partial order if its reflexive, antisymmetric, and transitive.

item.title: Relation
item.description: :ID: efd79527-1cfb-48da-868e-6286cff21c34 A relation is any subset of a Cartesian product. For instance, a relation \(R\) over any subset of \(X \times X\) is called a “Relation on \(X\)”. A Relation \(R\) is said to be reflexive if \(\forall x \in X: (x,x) \in R\). A Relation \(R\) is said to be symmetric if \(\forall x,y \in X: (x,y) \in R \implies (y,x) \in R\). A Relation \(R\) is antisymmetric if \(\forall x,y \in X: (x,y) \in R \land (y,x) \in R \implies x = y\).
